types1:Item.types1:Name: github-gist
types1:Item.types1:Description:
Github REST V3 APi to manage Gists see https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/
This connector is useful to store and retrive configurations, templates, snippets, etc

businessConnector.name: github-gist
businessConnector.description:
Github REST V3 APi to manage Gists see https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/
This connector is useful to store and retrive configurations, templates, snippets, etc

connectionAttribute.description: Base URI of the REST endpoint should be https://api.github.com
connectionAttribute.name: base_uri

parameter.description: When enabled Action will return all Action response headers
parameter.name: get_response_headers

parameter.description: Use this parameter with actions that return paged lists, this will parse URLs for page next,last, prvious/first from Link Response header <https://api.github.com/search/code?q=addClass+user%3Amozilla&page=15>; rel="next", <https://api.github.com/search/code?q=addClass+user%3Amozilla&page=34>; rel="last", <https://api.github.com/search/code?q=addClass+user%3Amozilla&page=1>; rel="first", <https://api.github.com/search/code?q=addClass+user%3Amozilla&page=13>; rel="prev"
parameter.name: parse_paging_links

field.description: Response Headers are provided when the parameter get_response_headers is set to true
field.name: responseHeaders

field.description:
This Output parameter will be generated for actions that return lists when the parse_paging_links parameter is set to true.
See https://developer.github.com/v3/guides/traversing-with-pagination/
field.name: pagingLinks
field.xquery:
{if (string($parse_paging_links) = 'true' ) then let $link-header := data($ResponseHeaders[@name="link"]/text()) (: parsing the Link Response header for paging See https://developer.github.com/v3/guides/traversing-with-pagination/ :) let $items := tokenize($link-header,",") let $links := for $item in $items let $link-parts := tokenize($item,";") let $URL := substring($link-parts[1],2,string-length($link-parts[1])-2) let $rel := tokenize(normalize-space($link-parts[2]),"=")[2] return <link> <rel>{$rel}</rel> <url>{$URL}</url> </link>
return $links else ()}

action.label: getPublicGists
action.name: getPublicGists
action.description:
List all public gists sorted by most recently updated to least recently updated.
Note: With pagination, you can fetch up to 3000 gists. For example, you can fetch 100 pages with 30 gists per page or 30 pages with 100 gists per page.

parameter.description: This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. Only gists updated at or after this time are returned.
parameter.name: since

parameter.description: By passing the per_page parameter, you can specify how many items you want each page to return, up to 100 items.
parameter.name: per_page

field.name: gists

action.label: getStarredGists
action.name: getStarredGists
action.description: List the authenticated user's starred gists:

parameter.description: This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. Only gists updated at or after this time are returned.
parameter.name: since

parameter.description: By passing the per_page parameter, you can specify how many items you want each page to return, up to 100 items.
parameter.name: per_page

field.name: gists

action.label: getGist
action.name: getGist
action.description: Get a single gist To get a specific version of the Gist also provide sha signature parameter

parameter.description: SHA ID of the Gist revision
parameter.name: sha

action.label: createGist
action.name: createGist
action.description: Allows you to add a new gist with one or more files.

parameter.name: gist

action.label: updateGist
action.name: updateGist
action.description: Allows you to update or delete a gist file and rename gist files. Files from the previous version of the gist that aren't explicitly changed during an edit are unchanged.

parameter.name: gist

parameter.description: Use this parameter to parse raw data to desired format and present as xml object
parameter.name: parse_as

field.name: parsed_xml
field.xquery: {switch ($parse_as) case 'xml' return util:parseXML($RESTResponse/*:payload/text()) case 'json' return util:parseJSON(jsonStr) default return ()}

action.label: getUserGists
action.name: getUserGists
action.description: List the authenticated user's gists or if called anonymously, this will return all public gists

parameter.description: This is a timestamp in ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. Only gists updated at or after this time are returned.
parameter.name: since

parameter.description: By passing the per_page parameter, you can specify how many items you want each page to return, up to 100 items
parameter.name: per_page

field.name: gists

action.label: geGistsResultPage
action.name: geGistsResultPage
action.description: Action to retrieve specific page based on links generated in Listing response header

field.name: gists

action.label: getUserProfile
action.name: getUserProfile
action.description: get User Profile using Connector Credentials

action.label: getPublicGist
action.name: getPublicGist
action.description: Retrieves Public Gist using the raw URL such as https://gist.githubusercontent.com/jbrazda/a50b178232eb3d43ec3ca1e117e09cdf/raw/fc7f7831c2641b3aa54f1be09062ee9841167c01/IICS_Logging_MDAS_CreateSchema_MSSQL.xml

processObject.name: pageLink
processObject.description: Parsed page Links for paging the get list result sets See
